name: MITRE ATT&CK
description: MITRE ATT&CK Framework techniques (subset for RansomEye)

techniques.name: Brute Force
techniques.description: Adversaries may use brute force techniques to gain access to accounts when passwords are unknown or when password hashes are obtained.

techniques.name: Remote Services
techniques.description: Adversaries may use remote services to move between systems and access data.

techniques.name: Exploitation for Privilege Escalation
techniques.description: Adversaries may exploit software vulnerabilities to elevate privileges.

techniques.name: Create or Modify System Process
techniques.description: Adversaries may create or modify system processes to establish persistence.

techniques.name: Exfiltration Over C2 Channel
techniques.description: Adversaries may steal data by exfiltrating it over an existing command and control channel.

techniques.name: Application Layer Protocol
techniques.description: Adversaries may communicate using application layer protocols to avoid detection/network filtering.

techniques.name: Impair Defenses
techniques.description: Adversaries may impair security controls to avoid detection.

techniques.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter
techniques.description: Adversaries may abuse command and script interpreters to execute commands, scripts, or binaries.

techniques.name: File and Directory Discovery
techniques.description: Adversaries may enumerate files and directories to understand the environment.

techniques.name: Data Encrypted for Impact
techniques.description: Adversaries may encrypt data on target systems to interrupt availability and system access.
